summary: Webserver on Port !== 80 is not supported

comments.content: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Use Webserver on Port !== 80 2. Use closure-compiler with js file on this browser 3. see error message >What is the expected output? closure-compiler should work :-) >What do you see instead? closure-compiler does not work :-P 12: URL http://correctHostname:8015/JavaScript/class.js is not formed properly. Original Post Data: output_format=json&output_info=compiled_code&output_info=warnings&output_info=errors&output_info=statistics&compilation_level=SIMPLE_OPTIMIZATIONS&warning_level=default&code_url=http %3A%2F%correctHostname%3A8015%2FJavaScript%2Fclass.js&js_code= Serving the same JS from a Webserver on Port 80 works. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? http://closure-compiler.appspot.com/home with Browser Opera 10.01 Please provide any additional information below.

The web service is hosted on AppEngine, and to prevent abuse, AppEngine does not allow 
connections to non-standard port:

http://code.google.com/appengine/docs/java/urlfetch/overview.html

"... The URL must use the standard ports for HTTP (80) and HTTPS (443). The port is implied 
by the scheme, but may also be mentioned in the URL as long as the port is standard for the 
scheme (https://...:443/). An app cannot connect to an arbitrary port of a remote host, nor 
can it use a non-standard port for a scheme. ..."

Considering downloading and using the compiler locally:

http://code.google.com/p/closure-compiler/
